clinical_study.brief_title: STUDY OF PF-07321332 IN HEALTHY PARTICIPANTS
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1, RANDOMIZED, DOUBLE-BLIND, SPONSOR-OPEN, PLACEBO CONTROLLED, SINGLE- AND MULTIPLE-DOSE ESCALATION STUDY TO EVALUATE THE SAFETY, TOLERABILITY, AND PHARMACOKINETICS OF PF-07321332 IN HEALTHY ADULT PARTICIPANTS

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 1, double blind, sponsor open, single and multiple ascending dose study to evaluate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of PF-07321332 in healthy participants.

detailed_description.textblock: Combined 5-part study. Part-1: Single Ascending dose Part-2: Multiple Ascending Dose Part-3: Relative bioavailability and food effect Part-4: Metabolism and Excretion Part-5: Supra-therapeutic Exposure Part-1,2 and 5 are double blind, sponsor open and Part-3 and 4 are open label study.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) in single ascending dose (SAD)
primary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. A serious adverse event (SAE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that results in death; is life threatening; requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; results in persistent disability/incapacity; results in congenital anomaly/birth defect. AEs include both SAEs and AEs. TEAEs are AEs that occur following the start of treatment or AEs increasing in severity during treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Vital Signs in SAD
Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities in SAD
Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings in SAD
primary_outcome.description: Criteria for clinically significant changes in ECG (12-lead) are defined as: a postdose QTc interval increase by ≥30 msec from the baseline and is >450 msec; or an absolute QTc value is ≥500 msec for any scheduled ECG

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with TEAEs in multiple ascending dose (MAD)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. An SAE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that results in death; is life threatening; requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; results in persistent disability/incapacity; results in congenital anomaly/birth defect. AEs include both SAEs and AEs. TEAEs are AEs that occur following the start of treatment or AEs increasing in severity during treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Vital Signs in MAD
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs evaluation includes: supine systolic and diastolic blood pressure (BP), temperature, respiratory rate and pulse rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities in MAD
Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in ECGs Findings in MAD
primary_outcome.description: Criteria for clinically significant changes in ECG (12-lead) are defined as: a postdose QTc interval increase by ≥30 msec from the baseline and is >450 msec; or an absolute QTc value is ≥500 msec for any scheduled ECG

primary_outcome.measure: Total % cumulative recovery of drug related material in metabolism and excretion (ME)
primary_outcome.description: Drug related material excreted in urine and feces combined

primary_outcome.measure: The ratio of AUClast in relative bioavailability (RBA)
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of AUClast of test vs reference formulation

primary_outcome.measure: The ratio of Cmax in RBA
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of Cmax of test vs reference formulation

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) in supratherapeutic exposure (SE)
primary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. A serious adverse event (SAE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence at any dose that results in death; is life threatening; requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; results in persistent disability/incapacity; results in congenital anomaly/birth defect. AEs include both SAEs and AEs. TEAEs are AEs that occur following the start of treatment or AEs increasing in severity during treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Vital Signs in SE
Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities in SE
Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings in SE
primary_outcome.description: Criteria for clinically significant changes in ECG (12-lead) are defined as: a postdose QTc interval increase by ≥30 msec from the baseline and is >450 msec; or an absolute QTc value is ≥500 msec for any scheduled ECG

secondary_outcome.description: The maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) is estimated based on the plasma concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose Normalized Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax[dn]) in SAD
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax(dn) = Cmax / dose.
Tmax was summarized by dosing regimen. It was observed directly from data as time of first occurrence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Profile From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) in SAD
secondary_outcome.description: AUClast is summarized by dosing regimen and determined by linear/log trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.description: AUClast /dose
Observed Cmax is estimated based on the plasma concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Profile From Time Zero To End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau) in MAD-Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau is summarized by dosing regimen and period. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval is 8 hours for three times daily (TID) dosing and 12 hours for twice daily (BID) dosing. It is determined by linear/log trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose Normalized Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Profile From Time Zero To End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau[dn]) in MAD-Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau/dose is summarized by dosing regimen and period. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing. I

AUCtau is summarized by dosing regimen and period. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing. It is determined by linear/log trapezoidal method.

AUCtau/dose is summarized by dosing regimen and period. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing. I

AUCtau is summarized by dosing regimen and period. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing. It is determined by linear/log trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose Normalized Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Profile From Time Zero To End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau[dn]) in MAD-Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau/dose is summarized by dosing regimen and period. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing. I

secondary_outcome.measure: Lowest Concentration Observed During the Dosing Interval tau (Cmin) in MAD-Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Cmin is observed directly from data. It is summarized by dosing regimen. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval tau is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing.

Cmin is observed directly from data. It is summarized by dosing regimen. Dosing interval is the interval tau between administration of doses of drug. In this study, the dosing interval tau is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 Pre dose (0 hours) to Day 12 (48 hours post dose)
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2 is summarized by dosing regimen . It is determined by loge(2)/kel, where kel is the terminal phase rate constant calculated by a linear regression of the log linear concentration time curve. Only those data points judged to describe the terminal log linear decline is used in the regression.

Vz/F is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. VZ/F after oral dose is influenced by the fraction absorbed.
PTR = Cmax,ss / Cmin,ss, where ss means 'at steady state'. It is summarized by dosing regimen .
PTR = Cmax,ss / Cmin,ss, where ss means 'at steady state'. It is summarized by dosing regimen .

secondary_outcome.measure: Observed Accumulation Ratio Based on AUC (Rac) in MAD-Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Rac = AUCtau,ss / AUCtau,sd, where ss means 'at steady state' and sd 'single dose'. In this study, Rac = AUCtau(Day 5) / AUCtau(Day 1). Rac is summarized by dosing regimen.
Rac = AUCtau,ss / AUCtau,sd, where ss means 'at steady state' and sd 'single dose'. In this study, Rac = AUCtau(Day 10) / AUCtau(Day 1). Rac is summarized by dosing regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Observed Accumulation Ratio Based on Cmax (Rac,Cmax) in MAD-Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: Rac,Cmax = Cmax,ss / Cmax,sd, where ss means 'at steady state' and sd 'single dose'. In this study, Rac,Cmax = Cmax(Day5) / Cmax(Day 1). Rac,Cmax is summarized by dosing regimen.
Rac,Cmax = Cmax,ss / Cmax,sd, where ss means 'at steady state' and sd 'single dose'. In this study, Rac,Cmax = Cmax(Day10) / Cmax(Day 1). Rac,Cmax is summarized by dosing regimen.

CL/F is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. calculated as Dose/AUC tau. Dosing interval (tau) is 8 h for TID dosing and 12 h for BID dosing.

CL/F is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. calculated as Dose/AUC tau. Dosing interval (tau) is 8 h for TID dosing and 12 h for BID dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Amount of Drug Recovered Unchanged in Urine From Time 0 to the Dosing Interval tau Hours Post-Dose (Aetau) in MAD-Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of (urine volume × urine concentration) for each collection over the dosing interval tau. Dosing interval (tau) is 8h for TID and 12 h for BID dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Dose Recovered Unchanged in Urine From Time 0 to the Dosing Interval tau Hours Post-Dose (Aetau%) in MAD-Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: Aetau% = Aetau / Dose * 100. Aetau% is summarized by dosing regimen. Dosing interval (tau) is 8h for TID and 12 h for BID dosing.

Renal clearance is calculated as cumulative amount of drug recovered unchanged in urine during the dosing interval (Aetau) divided by area under the plasma concentration time-curve from time zero to end of dosing interval (AUCtau), where dosing interval is 8 hours for TID dosing and 12 hours for BID dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in Metabolism and Excretion (ME)
secondary_outcome.description: The maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) is estimated based on the plasma concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Time for Cmax (Tmax) in Metabolism and Excretion (ME)
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax was summarized by dosing regimen. It was observed directly from data as time of first occurrence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Profile From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) in Metabolism and Excretion (ME)
secondary_outcome.description: AUClast is summarized by dosing regimen and determined by linear/log trapezoidal method.
The maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) is estimated based on the plasma concentrations
Tmax was summarized by dosing regimen. It was observed directly from data as time of first occurrence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Profile From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) in SE
secondary_outcome.description: AUClast is summarized by dosing regimen and determined by linear/log trapezoidal method.

arm_group.description: Dose level 4 of PF-07321332 with high fat meal

intervention.description: PF-07321332 Dose 5 or Placebo with high fat meal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male or female subjects between ages of 18-60 years. Male only in part-4.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 17.5 to 30.5kg/m2; and a total body weight >50kg (110lbs)
- Japanese subjects who have four Japanese biologic grandparents born in Japan
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant hematological, renal, endocrine, pulmonary, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hepatic, psychiatric, neurologic, or allergic disease (including drug allergies, but excluding untreated, asymptomatic, seasonal allergies at time of dosing)
- Any condition possibly affecting drug absorption (eg, gastrectomy, cholecystectomy, intestinal resection).
- Positive test result for SARS-CoV-2 infection at the time of screening or Day-1.
- Have received COVID-19 vaccine within 7 days before screening or have received only one of the 2 required doses of COVID-19 vaccine
- Use of tobacco or nicotine containing products in excess of the equivalents of 5 cigarettes per day or 2 chews of tobacco per day

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
